data.title: WEDDINGS; Gannon Hunt And Beau Turner
data.text:
Elizabeth Gannon Hunt, the daughter of Laura Bayoud Hunt and Ward Hunt, both of Dallas, was married there yesterday to Reed Beauregard Turner, a son of Jane Smith Turner and Ted Turner, both of Atlanta. The Rev. Dr. Mark S. Anschutz performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Michael and All Angels Church.

Mrs. Turner, 24, is known as Gannon. She is a contributing editor at Veranda, an interior design magazine in Atlanta, and is a hunting and fishing enthusiast. She graduated from Sweet Briar College. Her father is the president and chief executive of MedicalControl, a preferred provider organization in Dallas. Her mother is an interior decorator in Dallas and a director of the Henry Street Settlement in New York.

The bride is a stepdaughter of Lynn Skipworth Hunt and a great-great niece of H. L. Hunt, who founded the Hunt Oil Company in Texas.

Mr. Turner, 31, is known as Beau. He is a vice president of Turner Enterprises in Atlanta, overseeing the hunting and fishing programs and property acquisitions at the ranches operated by the company, which manages his father's personal properties and investments. The bridegroom is also the chairman of the Turner Endangered Species Fund in Gallatin Gateway, Mont., and a director of the Wildlife Conservation Society and the Wetlands America Trust. He graduated from the Citadel.

His father, who founded Turner Broadcasting and CNN, is the vice chairman of Time Warner in New York and the chairman of the United Nations Foundation and the Turner Foundation in Atlanta, which finances grass-roots projects on environmental and overpopulation issues. The bridegroom's mother is the founder of the Jane Smith Turner Foundation in Atlanta, which supports projects in health care, arts and education and on the environment. The bridegroom is a stepson of Jane Fonda.

The couple were introduced in 1997 by the bride's mother at a hunt on a private island off Long Island.
